body: @greatgautam committers can merge code into master. I've merged this change since there were no objections and 2 LGTMs. You can reach committers on a list or here on GitHub.

Hi,
I have created the PR and it is merged now. I'd like to update the status
of JIRA-23. Please let me know how can I assign a JIRA to myself?

thanks,
Gautam

wrote:

Hi, this is a good question. To be able to change state of JIRA tickets we need to do 2 things
- change project schema in JIRA (I was eager to do it, it is on my side)
- add you as a contributor.

Would you mind giving me some time to prepare an INFRA request?
Looks good!

Lars & Justin, thank you for review. Since my involvement into project seems to be not so constant as before, I'd rather fix all issues step by step. I created separated issue for jetty and picture issues fix: https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/TRAINING-25
@justinmclean added the license header and the information about explicit permission to use octocats in the material to Notice.

Hello!  I think you accidently merged the proposed TRAINING-28 (Hive) slides into the TRAINING-27 (Hadoop) PR.

I don't know if we have best practices yet -- but I find it very useful to have the JIRA link in the PR name (and optionally in the commit messages).

Can you remove the `.DS_Store` files from the PR?

Hi Ryan,
Thanks. I have added commands as well. Please review.

regards,
Gautam

On Fri, Dec 6, 2019 at 3:03 AM RyanSkraba <notifications@github.com> wrote:

> *@RyanSkraba* commented on this pull request.
>
> Hey, sorry for not coming back to this and thanks for addressing all the
> non-content points I raised.
>
> I actually thought the content was still ongoing! (I added a comment
> pointing to an empty slide)
> ------------------------------
>
> In content/Hadoop/src/main/asciidoc/index.adoc
> <https://github.com/apache/incubator-training/pull/63#discussion_r354771610>
> :
>
> > +== HDFS Checkpoint node
> +
> +Checkpoint node performs periodic checkpoints of the namespace.
> +It helps minimize the size of the log stored at the NameNode containing changes to the HDFS.
> +It replaces the role previously filled by the Secondary NameNode.
> +The NameNode allows multiple Checkpoint nodes simultaneously, as long as there are no Backup nodes registered with the system.
> +
> +
> +== HDFS Backup node
> +
> +Backup node is an extension to the Checkpoint node.
> +In addition to checkpointing it also receives a stream of edits from the NameNode.
> +It maintains its own in-memory copy of the namespace, which is always in sync with the active NameNode namespace state.
> +Only one Backup node may be registered with the NameNode at once.
> +
> +== HDFS Commands
>
> Empty slide!
>

It builds correctly, and the slides look correctly formatted!  I agree this could serve as a starting point for someone to build on -- as I mentioned, Hadoop is a vast subject!

Calling any committer to take a look :D

Have you been following this https://github.com/apache/incubator-training/pull/43 ?
this MR can closed..?
Closed for now due to license issues.

LGTM
As you said, it is a skeleton, but it renders and can serve as a basis for extending it in place. No need to get it perfect in the first commit.
We might want to rebase it on the recent changes to the pom file that @chrisdutz committed. But again, let's get it in first and then refine it.
Hi Justin, will you give us a quick shout, when this is ready for review, or are the lastest commits just minor things and we can take a look?
You can take a look now - it basically good to go

Re "Currently there are some title slides, then some examples of how content may look and then some more title slides. I was a bit confused by the ordering."

If you look closely the font section is for ApacheCon New Orleans, you can pick one of the title slides and modify the example slides as needed. The content after that is from previous cities we've had ApacheCons at. We could drop the other slides but it also shows NA vs EU use.

Makes sense to me, would it be worth adding a short sentence to that regard to the readme?

But LGTM overall, I've withdrawn my request for changes based on your answers.

Hi,
I have updated the PR for Apache Hadoop slides. Please review and merge if
it looks good.

https://github.com/apache/incubator-training/pull/63

thanks,
Gautam

>
> I feel, We can describe like below.
>
> The Apache Hadoop software library is a framework that allows for the
> distributed processing of large data sets across clusters of computers
> using simple programming models. It is designed to scale up from single
> servers to thousands of machines, each offering local computation and
> storage. Rather than rely on hardware to deliver high-availability, the
> library itself is designed to detect and handle failures at the application
> layer, so delivering a highly-available service on top of a cluster of
> computers, each of which may be prone to failures.
> ------------------------------
>
> In content/Hadoop/src/main/asciidoc/index.adoc
> <https://github.com/apache/incubator-training/pull/63#discussion_r363566531>
> :
>
> > +  distributed under the License is distributed on an "AS IS" BASIS,
>
> +  WITHOUT WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or implied.
>
> +  See the License for the specific language governing permissions and
>
> +  limitations under the License.
>
> +
>
> +////
>
> +:revealjs_progress: true
>
> +:revealjs_slidenumber: true
>
> +:sourcedir: ../java
>
> +
>
> +== What is Apache Hadoop?
>
> +
>
> +Apache Hadoop is a framework that allows for the distributed processing of large data sets across clusters of computers using simple programming models.
>
> +
>
> +Two main layers:
>
> +
>
>
> The base Apache Hadoop framework is composed of the following modules:
>
>
>
> Hadoop Common â€“ contains libraries and utilities needed by other Hadoop modules;
>
> Hadoop Distributed File System (HDFS) â€“ a distributed file-system that stores data on commodity machines, providing very high aggregate bandwidth across the cluster;
>
> Hadoop YARN â€“ (introduced in 2012) a platform responsible for managing computing resources in clusters and using them for scheduling users' applications;[10][11]
>
> Hadoop MapReduce â€“ an implementation of the MapReduce programming model for large-scale data processing.
>
>
> ------------------------------
>
> In content/Hadoop/src/main/asciidoc/index.adoc
> <https://github.com/apache/incubator-training/pull/63#discussion_r363566774>
> :
>
> > +== What is Apache Hadoop?
>
> +
>
> +Apache Hadoop is a framework that allows for the distributed processing of large data sets across clusters of computers using simple programming models.
>
> +
>
> +Two main layers:
>
> +
>
> +- Processing layer (MapReduce)
>
> +- Storage layer (Hadoop Distributed File System)
>
> +
>
> +== MapReduce
>
> +
>
> +Hadoop MapReduce is a software framework for easily writing applications which process vast amounts of data (multi-terabyte data-sets) in-parallel on large clusters (thousands of nodes) of commodity hardware in a reliable, fault-tolerant manner.
>
> +
>
> +The MapReduce framework consists of:
>
> +
>
> +- single master ResourceManager
>
>
> This is for YARN, not for MR.
> ------------------------------
>
> In content/Hadoop/src/main/asciidoc/index.adoc
> <https://github.com/apache/incubator-training/pull/63#discussion_r363567463>
> :
>
> > +
>
> +== MapReduce
>
> +
>
> +Hadoop MapReduce is a software framework for easily writing applications which process vast amounts of data (multi-terabyte data-sets) in-parallel on large clusters (thousands of nodes) of commodity hardware in a reliable, fault-tolerant manner.
>
> +
>
> +The MapReduce framework consists of:
>
> +
>
> +- single master ResourceManager
>
> +- one worker NodeManager per cluster-node
>
> +- MRAppMaster per application
>
> +
>
> +== Hadoop Distributed File System
>
> +
>
> +Hadoop Distributed File System (HDFS) is a distributed file system designed to run on commodity hardware.
>
> +
>
> +- similar to other distributed file systems
>
>

> > +== HDFS Useful Features
>
> +
>
> +New features and improvements are regularly implemented in HDFS. The following is a subset of useful features in HDFS:
>
> +
>
> +- File permissions and authentication.
>
> +- Rack awareness: to take a nodeâ€™s physical location into account while scheduling tasks and allocating storage.
>
> +- Safemode: an administrative mode for maintenance.
>
> +- fsck: a utility to diagnose health of the file system, to find missing files or blocks.
>
> +- fetchdt: a utility to fetch DelegationToken and store it in a file on the local system.
>
> +- Balancer: tool to balance the cluster when the data is unevenly distributed among DataNodes.
>
> +- Upgrade and rollback: after a software upgrade, it is possible to rollback to HDFSâ€™ state before the upgrade in case of unexpected problems.
>
> +
>
> +
>
> +== HDFS Special Nodes
>
> +
>
> +Main nodes in HDFS are as follows:
>
>
> Include high availablity, these nodes are almost not used now. We can try

> <https://github.com/apache/incubator-training/pull/63#discussion_r363568291>
> :
>
> > +== MapReduce Inputs and Outputs
>
> +
>
> +The MapReduce framework operates exclusively on <key, value> pairs, that is, the framework views the input to the job as a set of <key, value> pairs and produces a set of <key, value> pairs as the output of the job, conceivably of different types.
>
> +
>
> +The key and value classes have to be serializable by the framework and hence need to implement the Writable interface. Additionally, the key classes have to implement the WritableComparable interface to facilitate sorting by the framework.
>
> +
>
> +Input and Output types of a MapReduce job:
>
> +
>
> +(input) <k1, v1> -> map -> <k2, v2> ->
>
> +combine -> <k2, v2> ->
>
> +reduce -> <k3, v3> (output)
>
> +
>
> +== HDFS Architecture
>
> +
>
> +HDFS has a master/slave architecture. An HDFS cluster consists of:
>
> +
>

> +Backup node is an extension to the Checkpoint node.
>
> +In addition to checkpointing it also receives a stream of edits from the NameNode.
>
> +It maintains its own in-memory copy of the namespace, which is always in sync with the active NameNode namespace state.
>
> +Only one Backup node may be registered with the NameNode at once.
>
> +

Hello!  The presentation looks like it's in good shape.

If I understand correctly, each presentation should have it's own directory (and pom.xml), although you can have multiple translations for the presentation in the same directory.  [Zookeeper](https://github.com/apache/incubator-training/tree/master/content/ZooKeeper/src/main/asciidoc) is an example with English and German.

If you're planning expanding, we might want to consider directories such as `ComDev/Intro/` and `ComDev/NextSteps/` etc.

It looks like other presentations use ["your name here"](https://github.com/apache/incubator-training/commit/d82271c3392831653ebf66a03b90a2b5d621ecda#diff-c6e3dab0415c4e5001fa9c751c15b92fL23-L24) instead of the original presenters names for checked in materials.  I have no strong opinion about it!  Either way, a new presenter will have little work to do.

Let me know if you want to think about this more or commit it as is!
Have done all the suggested changes so if you are happy to merge then please go ahead.
Awesome!  There are a couple of files still in the PR from before the move (`ComDev/src/` and `ComDev/pom.xml` and `ComDev/ComDevIntro/src/main/java/war/StringUtils.java`).

My apologies -- I thought I could delete the files from github directly and move this along, merge right away!  Oddly enough, I could delete _some_ files but not others...

Can you delete the 3 duplicate files at `content/ComDev/src/main/resources/images/`? You can probably do it directly from the website (and it's probably a bug that I could delete the four files on your branch anyway...)
Thanks for the contribution!  This looks encouraging.
Hi @RyanSkraba thanks for spotting this and have deleted those files.
Thanks for the contribution!

It's the plan to release the build tools asap and to use the released version in all of the presentations in the repo ... this way we can update and test the tools separately and then update all presentations at once by updating them to the next released version.

Hi,
> There seem to be some dependency notices missing in NOTICE (at least from judging what Maven downloads when I'm trying to build things)? Maybe though my understanding of what exactly goes into NOTICE is dated
> 
Dependancies not include in a release donâ€™t need to be mentioned in LICENSE or NOTICE.

Thanks,
Justin

Typos, and removed mentions of helpwanted which is no longer active/functional/supported.

Hi Justin,
currently the goal is to initiate the project with a focus on "semi-automation" of documentation tasks. 
Most importantly, the prompts, the prompt templates, and the indexing logic will be developed and applied to small data sets, such as the docu-repos of several ASF projects. 

Now we have two options: 
(A) Creation of content, such as README or quickstart tutorials, or executive summaries etc.
(B) Automatic inspection of the content, using the "reference questions" as defined in the tool - and based on the result, a human editor can update the original documents in such a way that the questions can be answered. I

In case (B) no generated content will be published in a software repository, it is just temporary information which allows 
quality assessments and improvements in a standardized semi-automatic way.

I understand that following the path towards (A) is still a risk. Hence, the goal is the creation of tool which can be configured to use multiple LLMs, starting from public offerings to personal deployments (such as OpenAI model in Azure self hosted by a user vs. the fully managed OpenAI model which is used right now.

Is it possible to continue with this kind of activity, as long as we do not use the generated content as "Apache Training content", but rather work on an assistance system which supports content editors (especially for software documentation and for training material) to get better docs faster released?
Please see https://www.apache.org/legal/generative-tooling.html

OK, thanks Justin.
I will "process" the docs and come up with a conclusion so that we know what to do with the pull request and the idea of using LLMs in general.

Also for a PR like this ... a bit more description would be nice ... I think from having a look at the payload of the PR, I can get a rough idea of what it's about ... but I did notice quite some binary files being checked in and that's one thing we generally don't like to see in apache repos.
Ok, thanks for the feedback. I will provide description and a clean-up, especially the binaries.

Hey,

after being hit by a first wave of all the LLM Hype, I thought, it would be a nice contribution to the Apache Training project, if we would use this new opportunity. My first experiments with langchain made me confident, that this is the next great thing.

There have been several obstacles, e.g., the question: To what extend are we allowed to use LLMs in the ASF context.

I have realised that going forward on the tool-level would probably not improve the situation.
The tool I proposed would not generate content but rather would help developers and trainers to understand the code base 
and the available docs faster. But since other tools with the same focus have been built in between, there is no need to bring such a tool into this project.

We can use tools like: https://github.com/peterw/Chat-with-Github-Repo for this purpose.
I suggest to not focus in building a new tool, when others have one ready to use.*

But when I started working on this topic, I did not see this coming.

With this in mind, we can close the PR.
Thank you!
mermaid, and other sample/boilerplate content removed.

index.adoc
line 21 "two to" => remove "to"
  "topic categories" is sorta redundant. Why not just categories?
line 31: "you can click on" => why not just "click"?
line 36: "to personalize" => "to adapt the presentation to your topic"

I will look at the other files in a bit

newpresentation.adoc
line 22. "you've already built"  => "you've built" because you say already later in the sentence.
line 35: "This command will enter an interactive tool that will ask you some basic
questions about your new presentation" I believe the norm is to use present tense for program actions: "This command displays an interactive tool that asks you to provide some basic information about your new presentation"
lines 45-6: "remianing questions, by just pressing" => "remaining questions by pressing"
line 103: "and should be removed" => "and you should remove them" to reduce use of passive voice

presentation-tips.adoc
line 26: "then click on 'Presentations'" => "then click 'Presentations'" don't need 'on'
line 51: "director" => "directory"
lines 55-6: "This will open a second browser window with a preview of the next slide, and show you" => "This opens a
second browser window with a preview of the next slide, and shows you" present tense for program actions
line 59: "It will also show you" => "It also shows you"
line 79: "to make it feel" => "to make the presentation feel"
line 91: "No you are not" => "No, you are not"
lines 95-6: "please consider sending us a link to the video, on dev@training.apache.org" => "please consider sending a link to the video to us at dev@training.apache.org"

writing-slides.adoc

lgtm

I am done for now
